column1: full on leg stump, tries to clip it off his pads but misses. Hits his thigh instead. They scamper across for the single
back of a length outside off, straightens after pitching, tapped off the back foot to cover. No run on offer
good length on middle stump, outswing on offer, and takes the leading edge as he tries to nudge this towards the leg side. Lobs just over point and falls safe
back of a length on off stump, angling into Shehzad and it's pulled beautifully! Beats midwicket, and races away thereafter. Sat up nicely for the batsman to send this away
back of a length wide outside off, left alone by Shehzad. Not tempted by this wide ball
full on off stump, driven down the ground to mid off
full on middle stump, prods forward and drives through the line of the ball. Goes past the non-striker's right and beats mid on as well. A simple punch earns him a boundary. Off the mark
full on middle, clipped off his toes towards the man in the deep on the leg side
full on off stump, big stride forward and driven towards the cover region. Stopped by the infielder
back of a length on off stump, opens the bat's face and taps it to point. The infielder races in and stops the duo from stealing a single
good length on middle stump and angling across the batsman's body, glanced towards point off the back foot. Just opened the bat's face
full on middle stump, overpitched actually but not a yorker. Allows Shehzad to drive down the ground again, forcing mid off to give it a chase. Stopped in the deep eventually
back of a length outside off, stays tall and punches it off the back foot to cover
full outside off, tries to punch off the back foot but it's bottom edged behind the batsman. Comes off the bat's toe end with a big gap between bat and pad
back of a length outside off, tries to pull but plays for the wrong length. Plays over the ball as it goes through to the keeper

good length outside off, and it's pulled along the carpet once again! Off the bat's middle and it's racing away to deep midwicket, but a terrific diving effort from Anaru Kitchen in the deep saves two
terrific! Full and straight, and emphatically driven down the ground for another boundary. Stands tall and trusts the bounce as he hits through it's line. No chance for mid on

back of a length but too wide outside off, driven square off the front foot and it finds the gap between cover point and point. Races away. Controlled shot, played along the ground, with the bat's open face
back of a length on middle stump, cramps Zaman for room. Chopped off the back foot towards point
full on middle stump but angling across his body, slapped with minimal footwork past point once again. Got his front foot out of the ball's way and smacked in front of square
full on leg stump, misses the leg-side slog. Inside edges the shot onto his body
back of a length outside off, driven towards cover but comes off the bat's top half. Not hit well enough
good length on middle stump and angling into the batsman as he charges down the ground. Cramped for space. Tapped towards the leg side

there's a noise, but not out says the umpire. New Zealand review for the caught behind. Shehzad walked across to the off side, in an attempt to cheekily paddle this behind on the leg side, but misses the shot. Taken low by the keeper, but did it come off the glove? Yes, it did! There's the first wicket.
full on middle stump, nudged off the front foot towards the off side
good length on off stump, pulled towards midwicket but not off the meat of the bat. Dribbles away to the fiielder
full and wide outside off, slashes hard at it and lifts this up and over point. Work for Ish Sodhi at third man, who has to race across the boundary line to intercept
full on off stump, driven off the front foot but mistimed. To cover once again
good length on middle stump, and its pulled by the new batsman towards cow corner. Work for Kitchen in the deep once again, but his sliding stop ensures the ball does not go to the boundary
short outside off, and the extra bounce takes it over the batsman's cut shot. Came charging down the ground but the zip off the surface forces him to miss that shot
good length on off stump, stays tall and punches this back to the bowler
full on middle and off, shuffles across to the off side and taps this to mid on. They want a quick single, but none on offer
good length outside off, rocks onto his back foot and carves this past point! Muscles it away, taking full advantage of the room offered
full on off stump, gently turned off his toes towards midwicket for a quick run. Loud and early call for the run from Babar

short ball on middle and it's pulled! Thwacked so hard and off the sweet spot of the bat that the flat-shot goes for a six. Lands just beyond the ropes at deep backward square. First maximum of the evening
good length on middle, the batsman backs away and cuts but can't breach the infield
short ball first up, no real spin this time. Gets away with the loose ball. Pulled along the ground off the back foot to the man in the deep on the leg side
good length on leg stump, spins into the left-hander, pulled over midwicket, but the umpire calls it a no ball! Replays suggest that Sodhi's delivery was a completely legal ball. Free hit
good length outside off, and it's lifted straight. Doesn't have the distance, and it's taken by Southee at long off! But it's not out since the previous delivery was erroneously called a no ball
good length on off stump, backs away and carves towards point for a single
good length on middle stump, turns away from the batsman. Cut off the back foot, but there's the man at point for that shot
tossed up on middle stump, and Fakhar attempts a slog sweep! Misses the shot completely, but very lucky that the ball doesn't break off stump. Didn't pick the wrong'un at all
full on middle stump, played with soft hands towards short cover for a quick single
flat ball first up, on a good length on middle and leg, bunted towards cow corner off the back foot
full outside off, no real spin on offer and it's driven past the bowler's right to mid off
good length on leg stump, and the batsman backs away towards the leg side to make some extra room. Slapped past cover point thereafter

good length wide outside off, turned off the back foot with soft hands to midwicket. Nobody there inside the circle, and Babar calls nice and early for the second. Boult's throw in is great though, and forces Babar to dive into his crease
tossed up full outside off, straightens after pitching. Punched off the back foot to cover
fuller ball but outside off, carved square off the back foot with the bat's open face. But can't go past the infield
back of a length on middle stump, legspin. Tries to pull this behind square but mistimed to short fine leg. The batsman's in two minds, and can't play the intended shot

good length on middle stump, backs away towards the leg side and pulls along the ground to deep midwicket once again. Kitchen's been excellent in that region, another sliding effort in the deep limits it to only a single
tossed up on off stump, and this time he picks the wrong'un up. Got his front foot out of the ball's way and it's smacked over the non-striker's head. No chance for long on to race across
full on middle and leg, nudged off the back foot to midwicket with soft hands
short on off stump but spinning into the batsman, cut square off the back foot and Babar calls for the second once again. Direct hit from Santer in the deep, but Babar was in by then

sliced, but straight to point! Earns the wicket by cramping Babar for room. Floater on a good length outside off, and Babar is enticed to cut. Played with the sliced bat, and goes straight to KW. Simple take for the NZ captain
good length on leg stump, slower ball too, and the batsman is deceived sligthly. Muscled towards the leg side but the bat turns in his hands. Falls just short of the bowler on his followthrough
good length on middle stump, cramped for room once again but he attempts the cut anyway. Top edged, but falls just short of the diving fielder at short third man. Nice change of pace
good length on middle stump, tries to turn it towards the leg side but through his shot too early. Leading edge towards cover
back of a length outside off stump, sticks his bat out and pings it down to Sodhi at third man

overpitched full on leg stump, eventually a yorker as the batsman walks down the ground. Hits his bat, then his boot, and then lands up near his feet. But the batsman has no idea where the ball is, and he attempts to run. The bowler notices, and races down the wicket and kicks the ball onto the stumps. But the batsman was in by then
full toss outside off, and met by the batsman while charging down. Slapped while shimming towards the bowler, and beats mid off. Sends the loose ball away
back of a length just outside off, straighter one, cut to point. Misfield from the fielder as he dives across backward point, and the finger touch takes it beyond Boult. Chase for both fielders
back of a length on middle stump, muscles his pull along the ground to midwicket
full outside off, and it's swept off the front foot to deep midwicket. Sarfraz slips and is in splits while playing that shot. Ouch
floated outside off, and Zaman takes Sodhi on! Smacked so hard down the ground, and despite it being in the air, the bowler goes for self-preservation. Gets out of the ball's way just in time
full on middle stump, turned off his hips to midwicket and Sarfraz strugges to complete the run.
back of a length just outside off stump, spins slightly away from the batsman. Misses the cut, and sharply taken by the keeper
full outside leg stump after seeing the batsman back away to the leg side. Bunted down the ground to long on
full and wide outside off, this time it's swept to deep backward square but played rather tentatively. Waited for the ball this time instead of reaching at it
full and wide outside leg stump. Fakhar, though, was premeditated. Plays a reverse sweep towards the left-hander's off side
full outside off, and that's lifted beautifully over cover. Driven inside out, and beats both wide long off and deep extra cover. Neither fielder can stop that
awkwardly played! Full on middle stump, and Sarfraz almost yorks himself. Swept, but too fine. Straight to short fine leg
full outside off stump, and smacked with the spin once again towards deep extra cover. Floaty ball, and the batsman waited for it, before lifting it over the infield. Ends the over with a boundary

back of a length on middle stump, comes down the wicket and slapped to cover. They're racing across for the quick single. Dangerous, but CDG misses the direct hit at the non-striker's. Oh dear, overthrows, with no one backing up
back of a length on middle stump, muscled off the back foot to deep midwicket once again. Not timed well enough, which fortunately for the batting team, allows them to take the second run as well
short on leg stump, and the tall batsman ducks out of the ball's line. One for the over, says the umpire
full on leg stump, tries to slog this towards the leg side but can't get the connection. Played from near the bat's sticker area as it goes away to deep backward square
slower ball full outside off, sticks his bat out and delicately played towards the off side. Takes the top edge, however, and goes past the diving keeper's right. Work for Boult in the deep
slower ball full outside off, pokes at the ball and runs it down to wide third man

full on off stump, big stride forward and swept over square leg. Sarfraz slipped while playing that, but so did Tom Bruce at fine leg while trying to field. Fortunately, for the fielder, he managed to keep it inside the ropes
sees the batsman come down the ground and darted full and wide outside off. The tall batsman manages to stretch out and get some bat to ball. Bunted to cover
full outside leg stump, comes down the wicket and smacked past the bowler to long on. Couldn't get under that ball
back of a length outside off stump, stays tall on the back foot and pulled to deep midwicket

Taken? Yes! full and wide outside off, forces the batsman to reach at it once more, but Fakhar slaps it over point anyway. Man in the deep though, and it's an excellent catch from the outfielder. Dives forward and completes a tough low catch. Those dismissals are always difficult for the fielder to execute. Full marks. Small delay as the umpire wants to check if the catch was completed. Looks like Bruce's palms, ball in hand, hit the ground while trying to complete that catch. Were his fingers under the ball? Nothing conclusive on the replays. The on-field umpire's decision stands. Fakhar falls for 46.
full on leg stump with Sarfraz taking a wide stance. Driven down the ground to long off
full on middle stump, nudged off the back foot to deep backward square
good length on middle stump, angling across the batsman and punched to the deep on the off side
too short outside off, soars over the batsman's head as he comes dancing down the ground. Simple decision for the square-leg umpire
brave, and rides his luck! Good length outside off, and Sarfraz tries to heave it towards cover. Takes a thick edge, and goes over the keeper's head
back of a length, slower ball on middle stump, Pulled along the ground behind square to fine leg
good length on middle and leg, pulled by Haris to deep midwicket. Calls early for the second run
slower ball on a good length, and it's been punished! Stands tall and thumps his pull shot between deep midwicket and the man at cow corner. Threaded that shot beautifully
back of a length on middle stump, backs away and cuts to point. The shot isn't directed well, and goes straight to Guptill
back of a length on middle stump, slapped off the back foot to the man in the deep on the offside
full on leg stump, tries to paddle sweep towards the leg side, but misses. Hits his pads, but impact was outside leg
darted full on middle stump after seeing the batsman back away. Bunted to cover off the front foot
Santner wins the battle! Tossed up full outside off, and tries to heave this over cover. Comes down the ground but the shot takes the top edge. It's a skyer, and pouched by short third man
full on off stump, driven off the front foot to cover, but no run there
slower ball, but short outside off. Boult misses his length, and it's been slapped over cover! Hit well, and beats both deep point and long off
good length on middle and leg, going down the leg side and the batsman flicks it through to deep backward square
back of a length outside off, played off the back foot with soft hands. Nudged to point for a quick run
back of a length outside off, pulled emphatically to midwicket, but dropped by Sodhi! Went in cleanly, but popped out of Sodhi's hands as his knees hit the ground. Unlucky!
good length on middle stump, but angling down the leg side. Terrific stop by the keeper
back of a length outside off, the batsman goes towards the leg side to make some extra room, and muscled over mid off! Struck powerfully
short on off stump, takes his eyes off the ball while trying to pull, but gets enough wood behind thats shot. Goes to deep backward square, and Haris keeps strike
thick top edge, but falls safe. Short of short third man. Full ball on middle stump for which the batsman came down the ground. Tried to slog this towards the leg side, but the spin induces the edge
short on middle stump, rocks back onto the back foot and pulls over deep backward square. Does it have the distance? You bet! The fielder's a spectator

another drop! What is happening here. CDG the guilty party this time. Short on middle and pulled down the ground off the back foot. Off the bat's toe end and de Grandhomme fluffs this while running in
punished! Full on off stump, and it's smacked over the non-striker's head. Trent Boult, at mid off, sticks his left hand out as the ball, but can't catch the ball. Goes beyond the boundary
thumped! Full on middle and leg, comes down the ground and flicks this over deep midwicket on this occasion. Great use of the wrists
the bowler has the last laugh, though! Flat, full and wide outside off. Forces the left-hander to stretch, who drags his slog to mid on. De Grandhomme redeems himself after that dropped catch
back of a length outside off, pulled along the carpet to deep backward square. Only a single
good length on middle stump, swivels and pulls over square leg. No one in the deep there, as the ball goes a couple of bounces and into the boundary

yorker on leg stump, hits his boots as the ball goes down to fine leg. Terrific stop from the fielder in the deep. The dive saves the boundary, but the umpire thinks it came off the bat. Goes down as runs
full and quick! Tough to put those away. Yorker on middle and leg, and it crashes into his pads, before ricocheting onto off stump. A fiery delivery
full toss on off stump, opens the bat's face and runs it down to deep point
full on middle stump, gets his front foot out of the way and slogs through the ball's line. But hit straight to midwicket
starts off with a yorker that lands beyond leg stump. Takes his boot as the ball goes down the leg side. Terrific diving effort from the keeper
full toss wide outside off, safe delivery to bowl with the batsmen looking to back away. Slapped to the man in the deep
full on middle and off, smacked over the non-striker's head to long on. Well intercepted by Guptill
yorker on middle stump, squeezed away to cow corner. The ball reaches the deep very slowly, and allows them to come back for the second

dropped, and it's gone for a boundary! Low full toss on leg stump, clipped off his pads to the man in the deep. Bruce gets under it, but the ball pops out of his hands again. Tries to turn around the parry the ball back, but his body hit the ropes while trying to do so. Bruce signalled that it's a boundary

finishes with a six! Full on middle stump, and muscled over the non-striker! Got under the ball and sends it into the stands. The Pakistan fans in the crowd are delighted with that! A shame that he dropped the crowd catch. Pakistan finish on 181 for 6
full ball nips back in from middle stump, tapped to mid on
full on middle stump, flicked off his toes to midwicket. No run
full on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg
slips on his followthrough! Back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to long on
back of a length outside off, slower ball this time and KW is deceived. Tries to defend it towards cover but inside edge hits his body instead
back of a length outside off, angling into the batsman, and clipped off his pads to midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, punched off the back foot to mid on for a quick run
full on leg stump, flicked off his hips past short fine leg. The fielder's giving it a chase, but there's no way he can catch up
back of a length on middle and leg, stands tall and defends back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, punched off the back foot to mid off. Came down the wicket on this occasion
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to cover. Can't pierce the infield
back of a length on leg stump, tries to pull but can't make the contact. Hits his body instead
back of a length outside off, angling away from the right hander, and it's punched to cover. Can't go past the infield though
back of a length on middle stump, played with soft hands as he turns it off his hips to square leg

good length on middle and off, tapped to point for a quick run but it's a dangerous run! Direct hit and Williamson was gone, but the throw goes just over the top of the stumps. Amir could've been quicker to get back to the stumps, though
back of a length on middle, pulled rather unconvincingly off the back foot but has enough muscle behind that shot. Soars over the deep backward square boundary
good length on middle stump, backs away and slashes at it, but only to point
good length on leg stump, opens the bat's face with the delivery angling across him. Goes through to backward point
back of a length outside leg stump, cramps him for room. Squeezed away towards cover
innovative, but doesn't pay off! Good length on leg stump, tries to walk across and lap it over the keeper with the ramp shot, but can't pull it off
back of a length outside off, pulled off the back foot to deep midwicket
good length on middle and leg, walks across to the off side and simply flicks this off his hips! Flies over deep backward square. What a terrific shot!
good length on middle stump, tries to defend but takes the inside edge to square leg
slower ball full outside leg stump, deceives KW. Misses the front-foot defense
back of a length on middle and off, chopped down to third man off the back foot
excellent yorker on off stump, opens the bat's face and runs it down to third man. No other option for the batsmen
back of a length on middle stump, Guptill tries to heave this over the leg side but the ball goes across his bat
back of a length on middle stump, tucked off his hips behind square. Beats short third man, but deep backward square cuts it off
good length on middle stump, no real room to cut, but plays that shot anyway. Muscled to cover point
good length on middle and leg, turned off his hips towards the leg side. But straight to midwicket

strikes first ball! Good length and wide outside off, and it's been cut really hard. But, oh no, straight to Babar at cover. There's the first wicket! Quite a stinger that Babar took, but he managed to hold on to that. Taken from in front of his face
good length outside off, cut off the back foot, and beats point on this occasion. Starts off with the boundary
good length outside off, punched off the back foot to mid off
good length wide outside off, stands tall and carves this behind square once again! Terrific shot, and goes past point's left on this occasion. No chance for third man either
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot but inside edge onto his body. They want the single, anyway

full on off stump, and it's a biggie! Goes out of the stadium! We need to measure that maximum! Hit straight down the ground and over the bowler's head. Off the middle of the bat, and soars away into the night sky! Hits the top deck of the broadcaster's camera scaffold. We need a new ball! 108m
full on middle stump, almost a full toss, worked off his hips towards cow cofner
back of a length outside off, tries to cut but deceived by the straighter one. Takes the bottom edge
good length outside off, punched off the back foot to the bowler
good length on middle stump, turned off his hips towards the leg side. And there's the team fifty!
fuller ball, but pitched very wide. Spins further away but still inside the tramlines.
good length outside off, spins further away and this time Guptill chooses to get bat to ball. Poked towards point off the back foot
back of a length outside off, tapped off the back foot to cover point. No chance of a run
back of a length on middle stump, rocks back and drags this behind square off. Pulled along the ground
full on off stump, charges down the ground and meets the ball halfway. Driven but straight to cover point
back of a length on off stump, soars over Kitchen's head as he ducks slightly. Nice, attacking delivery from Yamin
back of a length on middle and leg, tries to drag it behind square once again but misses. Hits him where it hurts men the most!
back of a length outside off again, and it's pulled well over midwicket. Nearly holes out, but lands just short of deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, legspin again, tries to cut but misses the shot. The ball goes over his blade
full ball on middle and off, driven down the ground to long on
full outside off, prods forward and drives to mid off. No run on offer
back of a length outside off, tries to cut again but misses. Foxed by the bounce
another dot, another miss. Full just outside off, slower ball in the air. Goes straight through after pitching. Guptill tries to poke at it but misses
quicker ball to end the over. Good length outside off, and turns further away. Guptill considers cutting it, but decides to see the over out without any more danger. Left alone
back of a length outside off, tries to pull but the ball goes under his bat
full outside off, muscled down the ground, but only through to mid off
back of a length outside off, too short actually. Soars over Guptill's head. The ball man did not even duck. That's how short it was
soars into the crowd! That short length does not trouble a man with that sort of height. Pitches outside off, and angling right in, but he's quick to gauge the length. Smacked over long on
back of a length outside off, poked towards point for a single. Misfield from Shadab allows them to run
back of a length outside off once more, pulled again but this time played along the ground. Straight to the man positioned at cow corner
back of a length outside off, stays on the back foot and carves this past point
tossed up full outside off, entices Guptill to sweep but the legspin makes it tough for him to connect. Misses
the wrong'un this time, good length on off stump but turns into him. Tucked off his hips with soft hands to midwicket. No one there, and the bowler has to give it a chase. Smart cricket form Guptill
back of a length outside off, tapped past the non-striker gently to long on. The deep fielder has to race in, but they complete the second by then

full outside off, tries to drive extravagantly but the legspin induces the outside edge. Thick edge, but goes along the ground and finds the gap between short third man and backward point. That's 2000 runs for Guptill in T20Is

back of a length outside off, carved behind point and there's work for the fielder in the deep. Diving effort from the man and he kicks it away with his left foot before his body hits the ropes. There's his fifty
back of a length outside off, spins away from him, but pulled along the ground to cow corner
good length on middle stump, stays tall and turns it off his hips to deep backward square
punched off the back foot to mid off
good length outside off, backs away and uses his hands to purposely slash hard at it. Played uppishly, and soars over point
full outside off, prods forward and defends back to the bowler
good length outside off, but angling into Guptill. Eventually cramps him for room as he misses the cut shot while shuffling towards the leg side. How did that miss leg stump?
back of a length on off and middle, drags it behind square for more runs. Simply guided to deep backward square
good length outside off, spins away from him outside but misses

back of a length outside off, charges down the wicket but misses the shot. Tries to slog this over the bowler's head but he's deceived by the leg side. Goes past his outside edge and he's stranded outside his crease. Easily stumped by the captain
back of a length wide outside off, spins further away, cut off the back foot but mistimed to cover
back of a length outside off once again, cut off the back foot but only to point
room offered outside off, pokes at it and runs it down to backward point
holes out! There's the big wicket! Floated full outside off and Guptill goes chasing behind it. Swept in front of square but no distance in that. Comfortably taken by the navy man, Zaman
full just outside off, opens the bat's face and runs it down to third man
back of a length outside off, tapped towards point off the back foot. They want a quick run, and its a direct hit at the non-striker's. Replays show that Bruce was in
bowled him! The cutter pitches on a good length outside off, angles into the batsman, who misses his pull. Goes under his bat, and takes the top of off stump. Another big wicket falls
full on off stump, driven past the non-striker to long on. They walk across for the single
good length on off stump, punched off the back foot to midwicket. Tight bowling, cramping the batsman
short ball on off stump, swivels and pulls along the ground. Ruins the over with the boundary, to be honest. Terrific shot that had four written all over it
thumped! And taken in the crowd! Short outside off, and it's smacked over cow corner. Walks forward slightly and sends this into the stands
full outside off, big wind up from Taylor to slog this, but misses. Will feel bad to have missed out on it
another one! Full and wide outside off, but such is Taylor's bat speed that he swings and it's connected well. Slogged over the leg side, and soars over the deep midwicket boundary
full outside off, attempts the drive but takes the outside edge. Races down to third man
short on middle stump, backs away towards the leg side and carves this square. But there's deep point present

full outside off, tries to heave this over cover, but it takes the thick edge. In the air, and looks like third man is getting under it, but falls just short despite the fielder's dive. Gets his body behind the ball though
full on leg stump, Bruce backs away towards the leg side and hits towards long on. Gives the strike back to Taylor
heaved towards the leg side! Such beautiful connection. Full ball on his pads, and it's flicked with ease over the boundary. Great use of the wrists
low full toss on middle stump, slogged once again but not hit well enough. Goes to deep midwicket
that's yuuuge! Full on off stump, and Bruce joins the party now. Gets his front foot out of the way and hits through the line. Lands beyond long on!
full on leg stump, flicked off his toes to deep backward square. Gives Taylor the strike for the final ball
waist-high full toss outside off, muscled over mid on, and falls short of the outfielder. They scamper across for the second run
full and wide outside off, forces the batsman to reach at it. Pinged towards deep point
full on middle stump, dug away back to the bowler. Terrific yorker. Can't put those away

what's going on? Confusion all around. Full outside leg and it's a terrific yorker that he can't put away. The ball goes between both legs and through to the keeper. Sarfraz throws at the stumps at the non-striker's because the batsmen were contemplating running across. Amir thinks he's got his man: not with the run out, but with the caught behind. They've taken the review. And yes, Amir is right. The ball hit the bat before going through his legs. Brings an end to the cameo. Taylor tells his partner, 'I didn't hit it, I promise', before walking out. Interesting, but the replays showed a spike on the snicko
good length on leg stump, flicked off his hips to fine leg
full ball just outside off, tries to drive but misses out on this opportunity. Through to Sarfraz
full on middle and leg, worked away towards the leg side. Played to cow corner
yorker on leg stump, dug back but straight to Rumman. Great start by the bowler
well improvised! Full toss on middle stump that the batsman meets by shuffling across to the off side. Ramps it over the keeper's head. These shots are easy to play in 2018
crashes into middle stump! The bowler gives Bruce the silent treatment after knocking him over. Perfect yorker on middle stump. That's unplayable.

overpitched full outside off, tries to drive this over cover but the ball goes past his outside edge. Loud appeal for caught behind, but turned down. Pakistan are reviewing. Replays suggest there's no contact, and that the noise came from bat hitting ground. We're not sure, though. The umpire is having a closer look. Remains not out.
overpitched on middle and leg, clipped gloriously off his toes, and races away to the cow corner boundary. Hit so well that wide long on had no chance!
back of a length outside off, soars over Santner's head. Too short
yorker on middle stump, squeezed away towards the leg side. That's all you can do with a delivery that lands there

full on off stump, lifted over the bowler's head, and falls just short of the boundary. The captain's not happy, saying 'that's not the right length'. Got his front foot out of the way and hit well inside out
back of a length on middle stump, muscled down the ground to long on. Played off the back foot
full and wide outside the off stump. Angled away from him and it's too much for Blundell. Tries to open the bat's face and run it down, but can't make contact
full on leg stump and going down the leg side as Blundell misses the leg-side ramp. The umpire calls it a wide
excellent bowling! Slower ball full outside off, angling across his bat once again. Tried another ramp shot, but misses
back of a length outside off, drives with the bat's open face to the man in the deep
back of a length outside off, tries to pull but misses the shot due to the change of place. Sarfraz races it and congratulates hi bowler on a terrific over

waist-high full toss outside off, pulled over the infield and straight down the fielder's throat at deep midwicket. But, it's a no ball. Rumman was celebrating before he saw the square-leg umpire's hands stretched out. Free hit coming up
back of a length outside off, bunted doown the ground off the back foot to long on

good length outside off, heaved over to the leg side. Another skyer, that's going to long on, and dropped by Fakhar. Grabbed it, but once again as we've seen all evening, it pops out of his hand. Smiles all around though
full and wide outside off stump. Angling across him and through to the keeper
slogged! Back of a length on middle stump, stands tall and pulled off the back foot. Lands beyond long on
full on off stump, heaved over to the off side. Tries to play over cover but the thick edge takes it over short third man instead. Consolation runs
full on middle stump, and squeezed back to the bowler. He can't hold on to it as the ball hits the stumps at the non-striker's. Celebrations all around! Pakistan win by 18 runs!
